meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a horse.
meanings.sent1: The equisetic toy horse had a flowing mane and tail.
meanings.sent2: The farm had an equisetic charm with its grazing horses.
meanings.sent3: The equisetic horse costume made everyone at the party smile.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as equisetic as a graceful horse galloping in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The equisetic beauty of the horse's form captivated the artist's eye.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the genus Equus.
meanings.sent1: The equisetic markings on the zebra were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The equisetic nature of the wild horse fascinated the biologist.
meanings.sent3: The equisetic stripes on the horse blanket made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: Her love for horses was as deep and equisetic as the bond between twins.
meanings.sent5: The equisetic features of the horse breed were carefully studied by the breeder.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or pertaining to horses.
meanings.sent1: The equisetic show featured stunning horse performances.
meanings.sent2: The equisetic saddle was crafted with intricate horse designs.
meanings.sent3: The equisetic sound of hooves echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for horses was as equisetic as her love for art.
meanings.sent5: The equisetic grace of the horse's movements left the audience in awe.
